questions.neutral: Did you make it through the day?

hobby.message: Urban exploration or just drinking underground?
Analog photography survive another day in Stenograd?
Freestyle FPV drones still keeping you sane?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me - In free time, I explore the city's underground. It's a different world down there.
neutral_answer: Got through, just barely.
Didnt help that city checkpoints popped up on my route.
Was hoping to kill some hours with an old hobby, but citys too loud now.
Not much more to say about it.
Made it, in one piece.
Tried to get some downtime walking the old service tunnels.
Citys propaganda feeds found their way down there this week.
Cant even enjoy my hobby in peace now.
Feels like everyones watching.
Survived another round, just.
Spent the evening exploring sealed utility ductsmy favorite way to unwind.
I poke around old maintenance corridors, see whats left running.
Used to get nice and quiet; now propaganda and compliance reminders everywhere.
Last time had to show my work badge to three different guards.
Strange how even your hobbies arent safe from system glitches.
Yeah, made it though the checkpoints and half the citys flood of reminders.
Spent a few hours in underground tunnel networks; I like to keep tabs on old tech.
Urban exploration, mostlytunnels, heat exchangers, forgotten nodes.
Normally its peaceful, good for clearing your head.
Now even those places are shiftingpropaganda panels, new compliance checks at every hatch.
Last night, I could barely sip my flask before a scan lit up.
Cant help thinking things ran smoother before the factions started splitting narratives.
Barely, with my sanity intact.
You know, crawling the old tunnels, poking around power sub-basementsthats how I stay sane.
Been urban exploring since before the BCI updateskeeps my head clear.
Systems constant monitoring used to stop at surface level, now its everywhere.
Last week, a memorial debate broke out between two maintenance guys under P-blocknearly spoiled my run.
Had to skirt a checkpoint just to get to my favorite heat pump alcove.
Half my flask gone to nerves before I even started repairs.
Cant even trust the silence anymore; it all hums with Council bickering now.
hobby_answer: Urban exploration, mostly.
Easier than listening to factions argue all day.
Lately, though, too many new security checks.
Propaganda even follows you into the tunnels.
Suppose it's urban exploration, if you ask.
Mostly I like going where the system forgets to look.
But lately, tunnels are full of compliance reminders.
Even checkpoints down by old boiler five.
Hard to enjoy it when the city's watching.
Urban exploration—gets me out of daylight politics.
I like crawling the tunnels, old utility blocks—stuff Council ignores.
Been dodging all the new compliance popups down there lately.
Half my favorite entrances got fresh security tags.
People down there argue which Halden story’s true.
Hard to find quiet with propaganda echoing off the pipes.
It used to be silent—now it’s just confused.
Urban exploration—been walking those tunnels decades, long before BCI.
Old substations, sealed service corridors—they're half city, half museum.
Usually my escape, a place without policy.
But since Halden’s death, checkpoints trip you everywhere, random screenings too.
Propaganda terminals even run in the dark zones now.
Saw workers arguing over which compliance version they had to log.
All the new friction makes a solitary hobby feel loud.
Feels like even the shadows aren’t sure whose side they’re on.
Urban exploration—that’s my break from all this algorithmic noise.
Started as a way to avoid office politics, then the tunnels called me deeper.
Used to find real peace under the city—just dust, pipes, and my own questions.
Now, the BCI’s faltering and everyone’s got a version of Halden to shout.
Last week I ended up trapped in a conduit, checkpoint above wouldn’t clear my badge.
Even saw cables rerouted mid-walk—system trying to reroute people, not just current.
Propaganda screens glare at you, even where it’s supposed to be quiet.
People in the tunnels debate council narratives louder than the pipes.
Strange feeling now: like I’m trespassing on other people’s anxiety more than old city bones.
